However, that doesn't mean that they don't value the extra muscle a Bumble brings with them, and their fierce loyalty, unparalleled even within their race.

entries.name: Poison Adepts
entries: Vous gagnez la compétence avec le {@item Poisoner's Kit|phb}.

entries.name: Deadly Stinger
entries: Votre dard est une arme naturelle, que vous pouvez utiliser pour effectuer des frappes sans arme. Si vous touchez avec elle, vous infligez des dégâts perforants égaux à {@dice 1d4} + votre modificateur de Force, au lieu des dégâts de matraquage normaux pour une frappe sans arme. Vous pouvez utiliser la Dextérité au lieu de la Force pour les jets d'attaque et de dégâts de vos frappes à mains nues effectuées avec votre dard.

entries.name: Hidden Flight
entries: Vous gagnez un avantage sur les tests de Dextérité ({@skill Stealth}) effectués en volant.

entries.name: Wasp
entries: Long ago one part of the Vespoid swarm split off and left for the Dark Woods. Those Vespoids later became what is now known as Wasps. Wasps vary greatly from their Vespoid brethren, only their yellow and black stripes signaling some kind of relation between them. They have smooth chitin plates instead of fur, they are slender and tall and their feature seems jaggeder. They have a poisonous spike they use to attack. Most wasps live alone or in small families. They are cunning and intelligent creatures, though they are also quite aggressive, making them dangerous for other bugs. Only few criminal organizations, like the Black Leaf, employ Wasps, due to their uncontrollable temper.

subclassFeature.name: Weaver
entries: An Artificer who specializing as a Weaver employ threads to control and capture their opponents. They use a magical gauntlet that produces string and enhances nets with arcane energy.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item weaver's tools|phb}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Weaver Spells
entries: À partir du 3e niveau, vous avez toujours certains sorts préparés après avoir atteint des niveaux particuliers dans cette classe, comme indiqué dans la table des sorts de tisseur. Ces sorts comptent comme des sorts d'artificier pour vous, mais ils ne sont pas comptabilisés dans le nombre de sorts d'artificier que vous préparez.

subclassFeature.name: Weaver's Gauntlets
entries: At 3rd level, your tinkering lead you to create a of weaver's gauntlet, a magical gauntlet that produces magically reinforced threads. Creating a weaver's gauntlet takes an hour of uninterrupted work, which can coincide with a short or long rest, and requires the use of weaver's tools and 30 gp of materials. The First Gauntlet you create is free. The gauntlet is specially designed for you, and is ineffective when used by other creatures. You are proficient with the weaver's gauntlet.

entries.name: Spool Charges
entries: The abilities your weaver's gauntlet grants you, use a resource known as {@b spool charges}. Your weaver's gauntlet has a number of {@b spool charges} equal to 3 + Intelligence modifier + your Proficiency bonus. The charges replenish after you finish a long rest.
Using these charges, your wearer's gauntlet can produce a multitude of items:

entries.name: Net Shooter
entries: Using an action, you can expend one spool charge to make a ranged spell attack with your gauntlet against a creature within 30 feet of you, as you shoot a net at the target. A Large or smaller creature hit by the net is restrained until freed.
A creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success.

Dealing slashing damage equal to 5 x your Proficiency bonus to the net (AC 10) also frees a trapped creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. Furthermore, if the net is exposed to fire, it burns away within one round.
The net does not restrain creatures that are formless or creatures that are Huge or larger.

entries.name: Rope
entries: Using an action, you can expend one spool charge and shoot a rope from your weaver's gauntlet at a point you can see. The rope is up to 30 ft. long and sticks to any solid surface it touches. After the rope is produced, it can be detached from the weaver's gauntlet. You can spend additional spool charges to lengthen the rope by 30 feet per charge spent.
The rope is flammable. Any 5-foot of string exposed to fire burns away within one round.

entries.name: Whip
entries: Using a bonus action, you can expend a spool charge to create a piece of rope in an unoccupied hand. This rope can be used as a {@item whip|phb}, and you are proficient in attacks made with it. The damage of the whip increases to {@dice 1d8} slashing damage. You can add your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, to the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Web
entries: You can cast the {@spell web|phb} spell from your weaver's gauntlet by spending two spool charges. Casting the spell in this way does not require vocal or material components.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Weaver
entries: Also at 3rd level, you gain the ability to infuse the string from your weaver's gauntlets with arcane energy to create arcane nets.
When you use the {@b Net Shooter} ability from your weaver's gauntlet, you can spend an additional spool charge to transform the net into an arcane net.
You learn how to create three arcane nets of your choice, detailed in the "Arcane Nets" table below.

Vous gagnez la connaissance d'un filet arcanique supplémentaire au 5e, 9e et 15e niveau. Chaque fois que vous gagnez un nouveau filet arcanique, vous pouvez également remplacer un filet arcanique que vous connaissez par un filet différent.

While the net doesn't restrain huge or larger creatures, they are still affected by the special effects of the arcane net until they use an action to remove the net from themselves, no Strength check is required.

entries.caption: Arcane Nets Table
rows: Ce filet inflige {@dice 1d4} de dégâts perforants en cas de succès. De plus, une créature retenue par ce filet subit {@dice 1d4} de dégâts perforants à chaque fois qu'elle tente de s'en échapper ou qu'elle porte une attaque. Les dégâts augmentent de {@dice 1d4} supplémentaires aux 5e, 9e et 15e niveaux.
Les créatures retenues par ce filet sont {@condition deafened}.
Ce filet peut retenir des créatures de taille énorme.
Ce filet peut affecter les créatures éthérées et sans forme.
Les créatures retenues par ce filet subissent {@dice 1d4} de dégâts de feu au début de chacun de leurs tours. Les dégâts augmentent de {@dice 1d4} supplémentaires aux 5e, 9e et 15e niveaux.
Ce filet a une résistance contre les dégâts d'entaille.
Ce filet inflige {@dice 2d4} de dégâts de foudre en cas de succès. Les dégâts augmentent de {@dice 1d4} supplémentaires aux 5e, 9e et 15e niveaux.
Les créatures retenues par ce filet sont {@condition blinded}.
Les créatures retenues par ce filet ont un désavantage sur leurs tests de Force pour l'enlever.

subclassFeature.name: Binding Thread
entries: Starting at 5th level, whenever a creature restrained by one of your arcane nets or spells attempts to move out of the space they occupy by using a spell or an ability, it must first make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell save DC. On a failure, the creatures movement is interrupted and the spell slot or use of its ability is wasted. On a success, the creature is unaffected and can use its spell or ability normally.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Tapestry
entries: Au 9ème niveau, vous apprenez à combiner différents fils magiques pour fabriquer des filets arcaniques plus puissants. Chaque fois que vous créez un filet arcanique, vous pouvez dépenser une charge de bobine supplémentaire pour ajouter un trait spécial supplémentaire au filet de ceux que vous connaissez. Un filet arcanique peut avoir un maximum de 2 effets.
Lorsqu'il atteint le 15e niveau, le nombre maximum de traits spéciaux qu'un filet peut avoir passe à 3.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Cocoon
entries: Au 15e niveau, vous pouvez lancer {@spell forcecage|phb} sans dépenser un emplacement de sort, sans préparer le sort et sans fournir la composante matérielle, à condition d'utiliser {@item weaver's tools|phb} comme focalisation du sort. Le cube créé par le sort apparaît comme un cocon fait de sangles translucides. Une fois que vous avez lancé le sort avec cette caractéristique, vous ne pouvez plus lancer ce sort avec cette caractéristique jusqu'à ce que vous terminiez un long repos.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Symbiont
entries: The symbionts are strange, mimic-like entities. Many scholars believe they came from the Far Realm to Insectopia, but why they do not know. Alone they are merely specks, barely noticeable for most creatures. However, when they find a worthy host, the symbionts unleash their true and terrifying potential.

Barbarians of the Path of the Symbiont draw their power from a connection with exactly those alien creatures. When entering a rage, the Symbiont takes over and turns the host into a violent bloodthirsty monster, wielding the symbiont as a tangible weapon with deadly precision. The symbiont hungers, and its primal fury affects it's host. A symbiont may not always be evil, but with a need to feed and an appetite for conflict, a benign host is rare to find, much less a symbiont.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Blade
entries: À partir du niveau 3, vous vous êtes lié à un symbiote, une créature extraterrestre qui prend la forme de diverses armes. Lorsque vous entrez en rage, le symbiote vous donne des pouvoirs et vous accorde les avantages suivants :

items: Vous manifestez votre arme symbiotique. Vous décidez de l'apparence de l'arme. L'arme possède la propriété versatile et inflige {@dice 1d10} + votre modificateur de Force, ou {@dice 1d12} + votre modificateur de Force si elle est maniée à deux mains, des dégâts nécrotiques.
Votre arme symbiotique ne peut pas être désarmée.
Vous gagnez un bonus de +1 à votre CA.

entries: Les avantages durent pendant toute la durée de votre rage.
Additionally, when your features from this subclass subject a creature to a saving throw, the DC is equal to 8 + your Proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Apex Predator
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the symbiont begins to further alter your physique. You gain Darkvision with a range of 120 feet and a Climbing Speed equal to your Walking speed. While raging, you ignore the drawbacks imposed by difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Connection
entries: À partir du 6e niveau, votre Symbiont développe la propriété Thrown(20/60).

You can use a bonus action to call the weapon back to an unoccupied hand while it is within 60 feet of you. If you do so, the weapon spins back through the air towards you. Each creature in a straight line between yourself and the symbiotic weapon, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 2d6} necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Assimilation
entries: Au 10e niveau, le lien avec le symbiote qui sommeille en vous se renforce encore, faisant de vous un maître dans la poursuite et l'abattage de vos proies. Vous pouvez manifester votre arme symbiotique comme une action bonus lorsque vous n'êtes pas en rage.

De plus, chaque fois que vous terminez un repos long, vous pouvez permettre à votre Symbiont d'assimiler une arme magique en votre possession. Vous ne pouvez assimiler qu'une arme de mêlée avec laquelle vous êtes compétent. Votre arme symbiotique gagne tout bonus aux jets d'attaque et de dégâts et toute propriété de l'arme assimilée, mais conserve son dé de dégâts. Si l'arme a nécessité une syntonisation pour l'une de ses capacités, vous pouvez les utiliser comme si vous étiez syntonisé avec elle. Vous ne pouvez avoir qu'une seule arme assimilée à la fois. Vous pouvez remplacer l'arme assimilée par une autre chaque fois que vous terminez un long repos.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiotic Rage
entries: Au 14e niveau, vous pouvez libérer la bête qui est en vous et laisser le symbiote prendre le dessus. Lorsque vous êtes en rage, vous pouvez utiliser une action bonus pour entrer dans une rage symbiotique. Lorsque vous êtes sous cette forme, vous gagnez les avantages suivants :

items: Vous gagnez la vision aveugle dans un rayon de 15 ft.
Vous régénérez 1 point de vie au début de chacun de vos tours.
Votre arme symbiotique a une portée de 10 pieds.
Le bonus à la CA de votre arme symbiotique passe à +2.
Vous gagnez une résistance aux dégâts nécrotiques, au poison et aux dégâts psychiques.

entries: Si votre tour se termine et que vous n'avez pas touché et endommagé une créature depuis votre dernier tour, votre rage symbiotique prend fin ou vous pouvez subir 1d12 dégâts nécrotiques pour en prolonger la durée d'un round supplémentaire. Les dégâts que vous subissez grâce à cette capacité ne peuvent être réduits par aucun moyen.

subclassFeature.name: College of Pheromones
entries: Les bardes du Collège des phéromones ne sont pas des interprètes comme ceux de la même profession. Ce sont des alchimistes de génie, qui ne s'expriment pas seulement par l'histoire ou la musique, mais aussi par des lumières séduisantes et des phéromones captivantes. Leurs spectacles grandioses incitent leurs alliés à des actions héroïques.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Lorsque vous rejoignez ce collège au 3e niveau, vous gagnez la maîtrise de {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Pheromonal Orders
entries: Toujours au 3e niveau, les phéromones que vous émettez incitent à des réactions soudaines chez vos alliés. Vous pouvez utiliser votre action bonus pour choisir une créature volontaire alliée dans un rayon de 3 mètres autour de vous. Vous pouvez alors dépenser une utilisation de votre Inspiration bardique. La créature choisie effectue alors l'une des actions suivantes énumérées ci-dessous, de votre choix :

items: {@b Attack!:} La créature choisie effectue un jet d'attaque contre une créature à sa portée.
{@b Move!:} La créature choisie peut se déplacer à hauteur de sa vitesse de déplacement.
{@b Disengage!:} La créature utilise l'action Désengagement et se déplace de 5 pieds dans la direction de son choix.
{@b Dodge!:} La créature gagne les avantages de l'action Esquive.

subclassFeature.name: Pheromonal Dispenser
entries: Starting at 6th level, you learn how to craft pheromonal concoctions through pheromonal dispensers. Pheromonal dispensers are incense sticks or smoke bombs, that can be either thrown or put on the ground and lighted by using an action. When used they emit a cloud pheromones in a 10-foot-radius sphere for 1 minute, affecting any creature standing inside of the area.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you can create a number of pheromonal dispensers equal to your proficiency bonus.
Creating a pheromonal dispenser requires you to have alchemist supplies on your person and any dispenser you create with this feature last's until it is used or until the end of your next long rest.
You choose the kind of dispenser you create, from the list below:

items.name: Raging Pheromones
items.entry: Ces phéromones épicées incitent à l'agressivité toute créature qui en est affectée. Une créature qui touche avec une attaque de mêlée alors qu'elle se tient dans le rayon de la sphère inflige un supplément de {@dice 1d6} de dégâts de force.

items.name: Regenerative Pheromones
items.entry: These flowery pheromones accelerate the natural healing process of organisms. A creature that ends its turn in the sphere regains 2 hit points.

items.name: Nimbleness Pheromones
items.entry: Ces phéromones hespéridées éveillent l'esprit des créatures, les rendant plus vigilantes à toute attaque venant à leur rencontre. Les créatures situées dans le rayon de la sphère bénéficient d'un bonus de +1 à leur CA.

items.name: Cleansing Pheromones
items.entry: These stimulating pheromones cleanse body and mind. A creature that ends its turn within the sphere's radius and is either {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified} or {@condition poisoned}, is no longer affected by the condition.

subclassFeature.name: Controlling Pheromones
entries: Toujours au 6e niveau, vos phéromones peuvent désormais affecter vos ennemis. Vous pouvez lancer le sort {@spell suggestion} à volonté.

subclassFeature.name: Alluring Light
entries: At 14th level, you can target up to two creatures when you use your {@subclassFeature Pheromonal Orders|Bard|phb|Pheromones|PGInsec|3} feature or cast the {@spell suggestion} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Rot Domain
entries: The gods of rot uphold the natural cycle of life and death. Their clerics maintain this cycle by returning organic matter to the earth. To that end, they perform rituals and use magic to speed up the decay of corpses.
On Varzzen, the mysterious Mush-Folk are often clerics of the rot domain. They ensure that through rotting the old, new life can thrive in its place.

Clerics of the Theocracy of the Wurm also worship this domain in the name of their chaotic deity. However, they don't uphold life's cycle. Instead, their only desire is for everything to decay, so all can become one in endless chaos.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Rotting Touch
entries: At 1st level, your touch alone can cause organic matter to degrade rapidly.

As a bonus action, you can touch a creature and force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. The creature takes {@dice 1d10} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. When you reach 8th level in this class, the damage increases to {@dice 2d10}.

Additionally, you can use a bonus action to touch the corpse of a creature, a non-magical plant, or an object made from organic material. Over the next minute, the thing rapidly decomposes, turning into mulch.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Rotting Sickness
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to inflict creatures with sickness that gnaws at their very flesh.

As an action, you present your holy symbol and one creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. If the creature fails the saving throw, it becomes inflicted with Rotting Sickness, a disease that lasts for 1 hour.
Rotting Sickness is a magical disease that rapidly decays the flesh of creatures infected with it. An infected creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and Constitution saving throws.
The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, shaking off the disease on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of Decay
entries: Starting at 6th level, when a creature fails its saving throw against your Rotting Touch feature, it can't regain hit points. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with necrotic energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

subclassFeature.name: Herald of Entropy
entries: Starting at 17th level, your divine powers force structured organisms into disarray. Every time you damage a creature with a cleric spell of 3rd level or higher, you can force them to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, you choose an ability score. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws made with the chosen ability score.

The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A remove curse spell ends this effect as well. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours. You can only target one creature per spell with this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Mutation
entries: All Druids have the ability to shapeshift, transforming into wild beasts. Druids of the circle of Mutation, however, use that primal magic to improve and manipulate the very structure of their bodies. They assimilate the aspects of terrible monstrosities to go against the natural order, to become more that their mortal forms allow them to.

As such, other druids often look upon the unnatural rituals performed by these individuals with disgusts and terror. However, even they can't deny that circle of mutation druids achieve results far beyond a common druids capabilities.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Aspect
entries: When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you have learned how to change your body in more drastic ways than other druids, gaining the abilities of terrifying monstrosities.

You can choose two monstrous aspects from among the ones described below. After you finish a long rest, you can choose which aspect of the ones you know you want to attune to. You can only attune to one aspect at a time, and it grants you certain benefits as specified below.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you gain additional aspects, as shown in the Monstrous AspectsKnown table.
The following aspects are available to you when you gain an aspect. If an aspect has a level requirement, you must beat least that level in this class to learn the aspect.

items.name: Aspect of the Displacer.
items.entry: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage and fail the saving throw, you can use your reaction to re-roll the saving throw. You must use the new roll.

items.name: Aspect of the Froghemoth.
items.entry: While attuned to this aspect,you can use your Wisdom modifier for Constitution saving throws, ability checks, and calculating your hit points.

items.name: Aspect of the Hook Horror.
items.entry: While attuned to this aspect, you can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

items.name: Aspect of the Umber Hulk. (Prerequisite: 6th level)
items.entry: You gain a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus.

items.name: Aspect of the Remorhaz. (Prerequisite: 10th level)
items.entry: You gain resistance to cold and fire damage.

items.name: Aspect of the Roc. (Prerequisite: 10th level)
items.entry: You gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

items.name: Aspect of the Astral Dreadnought. (Prerequisite: 14th level)
items.entry: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

items.name: Aspect of the Tarrasque. (Prerequisite: 14th level)
items.entry: While you are attuned to this aspect, you grow in size as per the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Mutation
entries: Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to truly embody your monstrous aspect, rather than transforming into a beast form, and you gain 4 temporary hit points for each level you have in this class.
While you embody your monstrous aspect, you retain your game statistics, but your body mutates to resemble the monstrous aspect you have active at the moment.

Furthermore, you grow a natural weapon, depending on your attuned aspect, as detailed below. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add your Wisdom modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with it.
These benefits last for 1 hour or until you use your Wild Shape again.
Depending on which monstrous aspect you are attuned to, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Aspect of the Displacer Beast.
entries: Activating your Monstrous Form while attuned to the aspect of the displacer beasts causes you to grow two barbed tentacles from your shoulders.

The tentacles have the reach property and deal {@dice 1d4} piercing damage on a hit. Once on each of your turns, when you attack with your tentacles using the Attack action, you can make one additional tentacle attack as part of the same action.

Furthermore, you can project a magical illusion that makes you appear to be standing near your actual location. When a creature you can see targets you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

items.name: Aspect of the Froghemoth
entries: Activating your Monstrous Form while attuned to the aspect of the Froghemoth causes one of your arms (your choice) to turn into a slimy tentacle.

The tentacle has a reach of 10 feet and deals {@dice 1d8} bludgeoning damage on a hit. Instead of attacking with it, you can grapple a creature with your tentacle, making a Wisdom({@skill Athletics}) check instead of using Strength. While grappling a creature in this way, you cannot use your tentacle on another target. However, you can still attack the creature you are grappling with your tentacle.
You also gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe both air and water.

Furthermore, you grow a sticky prehensile tongue. You can use an action to target a creature no more than one size larger than you within 20 ft. of you. The creature must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be pulled up to 15 feet towards you. On a failed save, the creature also takes {@dice 1d6} points of acid damage.

items.name: Aspect of the Hook Horror
entries: Activating your Monstrous Form while attuned to the aspect of the Hook Horror transforms one arm of your choice into a fierce bony hook. If you hit with it, the hook deals {@dice 2d6} piercing damage.
You also gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
Furthermore, you gain blindsight within a radius of 30 ft. around you. While you are deafened, you can't use your blindsight.

items.name: Aspect of the Umber Hulk
entries: Activating your Monstrous Form while attuned to the aspect of the Umber Hulk, each of your hands transforms into a brutal jointed claw, which you can use as a natural weapon if it's empty. It deals {@dice 1d8} slashing damage on a hit.
You gain tremor sense up to 10 feet and a burrowing speed of 20 feet. You can also burrow through solid rock at half burrowing speed and leave a 5-foot wide by your height high hole in your wake.

Furthermore, you can cast the confusion spell centered on yourself without spending a spell slot, requiring no verbal, somatic or material components. You can't use this feature again until you expend another use of your Wild Shape feature to activate your monstrous aspects.

items.name: Aspect of the Remorhaz
entries: Activating your monstrous form while attuned to the aspect of the Remorhaz will cause you to grow scales, fangs, and fins. Your fangs are natural weapons that deal {@dice 1d10} piercing damage. Additionally, all of your melee weapon attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} fire damage.
Furthermore, any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack takes {@dice 1d6} fire damage.

items.name: Aspect of the Roc
entries: Activating your Monstrous form while attuned to the aspect of the Roc causes your arms to become mighty wings and your feet to become powerful talons.
Your size becomes Large, and you gain a flying speed of 40 feet.

You can use Wisdom instead of Strength when calculating carrying capacity, the weight you can push, pull or lift, and for Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to grapple another creature, and you gain advantage on Strength checks made to push, pull, lift, or break objects.

Your talons deal {@dice 1d8} slashing damage on a hit. When you hit a creature with your talons, you can immediately make a grapple check against the creature. While you are grappling a creature with your talons, you can't use your talons on another target.

items.name: Aspect of the Astral Dreadnought
entries: Activating your monstrous form while attuned to the aspect of the Astral Dreadnought transforms one arm of your choice into a bulky claw. It deals {@dice 2d6} piercing damage on a hit.

Furthermore, your gaze creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 30-foot cone. At the start of each of your turns, you decide which way the cone faces. The cone doesn't function while your eyes are closed or while you are blinded.

items.name: Aspect of the Tarrasque
entries: Activating your monstrous form while attuned to the aspect of the Tarrasque lets you grow an almost impenetrable carapace and a thick muscular tail capable of crushing walls. It deals {@dice 1d12} bludgeoning damage on a hit and double damage to objects and structures.

You gain a bonus to your AC equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1). When you are targeted by a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice 1d10}. On a 1 to 8, you are affected by the spell as normal. On a 9, you are unaffected by the spell. On a 10, you are unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from you, turning the caster into the target.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Transformation
entries: Starting at 6th level, you have advantage on saving throws against any spell or effect that would alter your form.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Prowess
entries: At 10th level, while your aspect is active, your attacks with your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to non magical attacks and damage.
Furthermore, you can attack with your natural weapons twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Cell Division
entries: At 14th level, you are able to imbue your mutations to your allies. When you expend your Wild Shape to embody your monstrous aspect as specified in the wild mutation feature, you can choose a number of willing creatures within 30 feet of you equal to your Wisdom modifier. Until your wild mutation feature ends, the chosen creatures gain the same number of temporary hit points you gain from this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Winged Knight
entries: Winged Knights are masters of aerial combat. Firstly, they dexterously soar through the air, summoning the chaotic winds of the elemental plane of air as they move. Then they unleash them in strong bursts, sweeping the battlefield.

subclassFeature.name: Tailwind
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, the winds always seems to blow in your direction. As a result, you gain a flying speed of 10 feet. This speed increases by 10ft. at 5th, 7th, 10th and 15th level.

You can fly for up to 10 consecutive turns. You fall if you are in the air at the end of the tenth turn. When you reach 5th level, the time restriction is lifted. You can't wear fly with this feature if you are wearing heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Wind Waker
entries: At 3rd level, you learn the {@spell gust|phb} cantrip and can cast it at will. Dexterity is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Typhoons Champion
entries: Additionally at 3rd level, you learn how to empower your movements and strikes with strong wind gusts.

items.name: Gust Techniques.
entries: You learn two Gust Techniques of your choice, which are detailed under "{@filter Gust Techniques|optionalfeatures|feature type=GT}" below.
Some Gust techniques enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one Gust technique per attack action.
Wyenever you reach a levvel in the Fighter class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one gust technique you know with a different one.
You learn one additional Gust Technique at 7th, 10th, 15th and 18th level.

items.name: Gust Points.
entries: You have a Pool of Gust Points that fuel your Gust Techniques. Whenever you use your flying movement, you gain one additional Gust Point. You can only gain one Gust Point per round in this way. Additionally, you gain a Gust Point each time you use the Dash action or score a critical hit. If you don't use your flying movement for an entire turn and have Gust Points left, you loose all of your Gust Points at the end of your turn. You can gain Gust Points up to a maximum equal to your Proficiency modifier.

items.name: Saving Throws.
entries: Certaines de vos Techniques de Geste nécessitent que votre cible fasse un jet de sauvegarde pour résister aux effets de la manœuvre. Le DC du jet de sauvegarde est calculé comme suit :

subclassFeature.name: Expert Aeronaut
entries: At 7th level, your maneuverability while airborne is unparalleled. You have proficiency in Dexterity saving throws while flying.
Furthermore, you have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone while airborne and take only half the damage from falling.

subclassFeature.name: Zephyr Step
entries: Starting at 10th level, while you are flying, you can use your bonus action to use the Dash or Disengage actions.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Sky
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you use your action surge feature, you also gain the benefits of the Dash and Disengage actions. Furthermore, you also gain a Gust Point

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Mantis
entries: La voie de la mante est un chemin que peu de moines choisissent d'emprunter. Pour maîtriser cette tradition, il faut d'abord maîtriser une patience absolue. Seuls les moines qui atteignent une sérénité absolue en eux-mêmes peuvent concentrer leurs coups avec suffisamment de précision pour désactiver le flux de ki des créatures vivantes. Les moines de la voie de la mante restent dans une immobilité parfaite, ne bougeant pas un seul muscle, attendant juste le bon moment pour frapper.

subclassFeature.name: Mantis Stance
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can use your bonus action and spend 1 ki point to enter a defensive stance that lasts 1 minute. During this duration,, you can use a bonus action to go in and out of the stance.
While in the Mantis Stance, you can't use your movement. Additionally, you can use your Patient Defense feature without spending ki points.
Furthermore, when a creature misses you with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to make an unarmed attack against it.

subclassFeature.name: Serene Counter
entries: Also at 3rd level, through stillness of mind and body, you can react quickly to the happenings of the battlefield. While in the Mantis Stance, you can spend 2 ki points to make one additional reaction. You can do so only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Pressure Strike
entries: Au 6e niveau, vous apprenez à débiliter vos ennemis en coupant leur flux de ki. Chaque fois que vous touchez une créature avec l'une des attaques accordées par votre caractéristique Flurry of Blows, vous pouvez choisir la partie du corps que vous voulez cibler. La créature doit réussir un jet de sauvegarde de Constitution, ou subir les effets détaillés dans le tableau ci-dessous. La créature ne peut pas subir les effets d'une partie du corps qu'elle ne possède pas.

rows: La créature ne peut pas effectuer d'attaques avec des armes jusqu'à la fin de son prochain tour.
La créature est {@condition blinded} jusqu'à la fin de son prochain tour.
La créature est réduite au silence et ne peut plus parler jusqu'à la fin de son prochain tour.

subclassFeature.name: Reaching Tibia
entries: Au 11ème niveau, lorsque vous êtes dans la posture de la mante, la portée de vos attaques à mains nues augmente de 1,5 mètre.

In addition, while you are in the Mantis Stance, any enemy you hit must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature loses all of its movement speeds except walking speed (such as flying, climbing and swimming speeds), as well as the ability to jump until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Stillness
entries: At 17th level, when you are in the Mantis Stance, you regain 2 ki points at the start of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Swarm
entries: The Oath of the Swarm is seldom sworn to a single deity. Instead, paladins of this oath vow themselves to their nation and people. They believe that to achieve greatness as a community, its people have to come together as one. However, these Paladins go even further than that. They do not only unite their people, but unite them to strike down that which threatens their nation. They are masters in weaponizing their people. As its always said: Offense is the best defense.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Swarm
entries: The exact Tenets of the Oath of the Swarm may vary; they depend on which group the paladin belongs to. However, they generally emphasize the following tenets.

items.name: One Body.
items.entry: The swarm if only as strong as its weakest link. So help the weak and raise them, for every member is essential for the whole.

items.name: One Mind.
items.entry: The swarm must work together to survive. Therefore, one must assess all viewpoints before deciding on the correct one.

items.name: One Spirit.
items.entry: The swarm is connected not only through body and mind but also spirit. Therefore, if they are to survive, the hive must make sure that there are no sources that could corrupt this spiritual bond.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: Vous gagnez des sorts de serment aux niveaux de paladin indiqués.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: Lorsque vous prêtez ce serment au 3e niveau, vous gagnez les deux options suivantes de canal de divinité.

items.name: Swarm Smite.
items.entry: As a bonus action you can imbue the strikes of your companions with divine power. You can choose a number of creatures up to your Charisma modifier within 30 feet of you. The next time a chosen creature hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional {@dice 1d8} psychic damage.

items.name: Hivemind.
items.entry: As an action, you can create a telephatic link between your companions. You can choose a number of willing creatures up to your Charisma modifier within 60 feet of you. For one minute, all chosen creatures and yourself can talk telephatically to each other while on the same plane of existence. Furthermore, if a creature linked in this way has to make a Wisdom or Charisma saving throw, they can choose to use your ability score modifiers instead.

subclassFeature.name: Mindshield
entries: Starting at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to psychic damage and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Hymn
entries: À partir du 15e niveau, lorsque vous utilisez votre capacité d'imposition des mains pour soigner un nombre quelconque de points de vie, chaque créature liée par votre capacité de divinité de canal d'esprit de ruche regagne également le même nombre de points de vie.

subclassFeature.name: Swarm Lord
entries: At 20th level, you extend your mind to lead your swarm to victory. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: If one creature linked by Hivemind can see or hear a creature or an object, all creatures linked by Hivemind can see or hear it.
Vous pouvez utiliser Swarm Smite et Hivemind sans dépenser votre divinité de canal.

Une fois par tour, comme action bonus, vous pouvez choisir une créature alliée dans un rayon de 30 pieds autour de vous. Elle peut immédiatement effectuer une attaque d'arme de mêlée ou à distance ou se déplacer à hauteur de sa vitesse.

entries: Une fois que vous avez utilisé cette fonction, vous ne pouvez plus l'utiliser jusqu'à ce que vous ayez terminé un repos court ou long.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Lord Conclave
entries: While most rangers feel a deep connection to the environment around them, others use their magical connection to reach beyond the barriers of our multiverse. Those weak-minded will find only madness when experiencing the Far Realm's abstract world, but those who don't go insane in the process can become a Hive Lord. These rangers gain an even deeper understanding of their surroundings through telepathy and can call upon aberrant spirits that take the shape of giant Insects to lend them a helping hand in combat.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Lord Magic
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Entomologist Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Call Drone
entries: At 3rd level, as an action, you can magically summon an aberrerant spirit from the Far Realm or another alien realm of madness, called an Insect Drone. It appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of you.

The drone is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. See its game statistics in the accompanying Insect Drone stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places. Whenever you summon the drone, choose a drone type: {@creature Bulwark Beetle|PGInsec}, {@creature Stinger Wasp|PGInsec} or {@creature Trap Spider|PGInsec}. You can determine the cosmetic characteristics of the drone; your choice does not affect its game statistics.

In combat, the drone shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can movve and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge|phb} action unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the drone can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge|phb}.

The drone remains forr 1 hour until it is reduced to 0 hit points, or until you die. You can dismiss the drone early as a free action. Anything the drone was wearing or carrying is left behind when the drone vanishes.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus + your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after you finish a long rest.

You can summon and control an additional drone at 7th and 11th level. You cannot summon a type of drone you already control. When you take your bonus action on your turn to command your drrones to take an action, all drones you currently control may take an action.

subclassFeature.name: Hive Mind
entries: At 7th level, you can use an action to mark a creature within 90 feet of you with a psychic tag for 1 minute. Any damage dealt by your weapon attacks or your drones to the marked creature changes its damage type to psychic. Furthermore, if a tagged creature turns invisible, it is still visible to you and your drones.
If the target drops to 0 Hit Points before this feature ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to mark a new creature.
Vous devez terminer un repos court ou long avant de pouvoir utiliser à nouveau cette fonction.

subclassFeature.name: Savage Swarm
entries: At 11th level, when you command to take the {@action Attack} action, the drones can make two attacks.
De plus, si vos drones sont obligés de faire un jet de sauvegarde, ils peuvent utiliser vos modificateurs à la place.

subclassFeature.name: Metamorphosis
entries: At 15th level, your psychic connection to the Far Realm allows you to summon stronger spirits. When summoning a spirit, you now choose from: Adamantine Beetle, Executioner Wasp or Hunter Spider. They have all the abilities of their previous forms in addition to the abilities detailed in the Evolved Drones table below.

entries.caption: Evolved Drones
rows: The AC of the beetle increases by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, when a creature moves into 5 feet of the beetle, it can use a reaction to make a pincer attack against the creature.

La vitesse de déplacement en vol des guêpes est augmentée de 10 pieds. De plus, lorsqu'elle utilise son action de piqûre pour attaquer une créature, elle peut attaquer à nouveau en utilisant son action bonus.
L'araignée peut désormais piéger jusqu'à trois créatures à portée en utilisant son action Web Shot. De plus, la portée du Tir de la toile est augmentée à 60 pieds.

subclassFeature.name: The Mimic
entries: Les Voleurs qui choisissent d'incarner l'archétype Mimic prennent l'apparence des monstruosités dont ils portent le nom. Avec une suite de capacités impliquant l'imitation de la forme et des compétences, les Mimic Rogues ne sont pas seulement des amis puissants, mais aussi des ennemis dangereux. Ils utilisent une capacité magique innée, qui permet à leur ombre de se modeler et de se transformer en copies de ce qu'ils peuvent percevoir.

subclassFeature.name: Mimicry
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@item disguise kit}
Furthermore, you can cast the {@spell alter self|phb} spell at will, choosing only the {@b @i Change Appearence} option

subclassFeature.name: Impersonation
entries: Also at 3th level, you can perfectly impersonate another humanoid, taking on its form. You need to spend at least one hour studying a small or medium humanoid (or creature of similar shape) you want to impersonate. You can only impersonate a creature with a CR or class level equal or lower to your rouge level. After that, you can use an action to polymorph into the humanoid.
You can use this feature twice. You regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Vous pouvez vous faire passer pour une créature pendant un nombre d'heures égal à la moitié de votre niveau de voyou (arrondi à l'inférieur). Vous revenez ensuite à votre forme normale, à moins que vous ne dépensiez une autre utilisation de cette caractéristique. Vous pouvez revenir à votre forme normale plus tôt en utilisant une action bonus à votre tour. Vous revenez automatiquement à votre forme normale si vous tombez inconscient, si vous tombez à 0 point de vie ou si vous mourez.

You can remember a number of impersonations equal to your proficiency bonus one. You can replace one of your impersonation by studying another humanoid for another hour, gaining the new form and loosing the old.
Lorsque vous vous faites passer pour une créature, les règles suivantes s'appliquent :

items: You retain your alignment, personality, Hit Points, Hit Dice, languages, weapon and armor proficiencies, and Intelligence, Wisdom and Charismas scores.

You retain all of your equipment, and do not gain any equipment the impersonated creature owns. Any non-magical clothing you wear changes to accommodate your new form but doesn't change size in material or style. Your other equipment doesn't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear merges with it or falls to the ground (your choice). Equipment that merges with the form has no effect until you leave the form.
You can't use or benefit from your racial or class features while impersonating a creature.

Your Strength, Dexterity and Constitution modifiers, all skills, saving throws and tool proficiencies are replaced by those of the creature you are impersonating. Furthermore, you gain any weapon and armor proficiencies of the impersonated creature and can speak any language that the creature knows.
Your movement speed changes to that of the creature, and you gain any type of special movement the impersonated creature has.

Vous êtes indiscernable pour la créature que vous incarnez. Si vous éveillez les soupçons, ou si une créature méfiante soupçonne que quelque chose ne va pas, vous avez l'avantage sur tout test de Charisme ({@skill Deception}) que vous effectuez pour éviter d'être détecté.

subclassFeature.name: Imitate
entries: Starting at 9th level, when a creature you can see is using an action or bonus action or a triggered ability, such as an Imp's polymorph or a wolf's pack tactics, you can use your reaction to attempt mimic it.

If the creature is unwilling, you need to succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against a DC equal to 10 + the targets level or challenge rating to copy the ability. You gain the benefits of the copied ability until the end of your next turn or until you use it once. You can only copy one feature at a time.
You can't imitate features that are inherent to a magic item, and you can't mimic spells or a creatures spellcasting ability.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Masquerade
entries: At 13th level, you perfect your ability to imitate other creatures. When using your Impersonation feature, the following additional rules apply:

items: You can use all of your class features while impersonating a creature. You can cast any spell you know, as long as your new form can perform the needed somatic and verbal components. You cannot use any spell or ability that would alter your shape.
You can use most of the features the impersonated creature has, including racial-, class- and background features.

You can't cast any spells the target can, and you can't use a feature that requires a spell slot. You can't use Channel Divinity, Eldritch Invocations, Artificer Infusions, or similar features. If the impersonate creature can change its shape, you can't use that feature. You can't use features that use a class-specific DC, like a monk's ki. However, you can use Unarmored Defense, Bardic Inspiration, Divine Sense or similar features.
If the creature has any legendary actions or lair actions, you can't use them.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Impersonation
entries: At 17th level, you can use an action to shape your shadow into one of the impersonations you know. The shadow impersonation looks exactly like that impersonation and has the same statistics, features, and abilities you would have while impersonating that creature. However, the shadow impersonation has only half of your hit points.
The shadow impersonation also can't change its form with the Impersonation feature, nor can it create a shadow impersonation of its own.

The shadow impersonation is created with copies of your equipped weapons, armor, and clothes but otherwise doesn't have access to your equipment. Any copies of magic items with charges have no charges left. Any equipment removed from the shadow impersonation disappears into a cloud of smoke.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the clone up to your movement speed to a space you can see, but it must remain within 120 feet of you. It can then immediately use an action. The clone lasts for 10 minutes or if it drops to 0 hit points.
Vous devez terminer un long repos avant de pouvoir utiliser à nouveau cette fonction.

subclassFeature.name: The Rupture
entries: While other sorcerous bloodlines have an overabundance of arcane energy, Ruptures are the exact opposite. They are irregularities in the Weave, points were no arcane energy exist.
Many military organizations gladly take up these ruptures into their ranks, training them to be used as efficient weapons against any spellcaster that would otherwise prove difficult to subdue.

subclassFeature.name: Magician's Bane
entries: À partir du 1er niveau, vous êtes attiré par la magie comme un requin par le sang. Vous pouvez lancer {@spell detect magic} à volonté, sans dépenser un emplacement de sort.

subclassFeature.name: Sundering Shield
entries: Also, at 1st level, when you use your innate magic to cast a spell, you can leech on some of the spell's magic to protect yourself. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can create a shielding aura on yourself that lasts until you finish a short or long rest. The shield has hit points equal to the level of the spell. Whenever you take damage, the shield takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the shield to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.
At 2nd level, you can spend 2 sorcery points when you create the shield. When you do so, the shield has hit points equal to twice your sorcerer level + the level of the spell.
The shield has resistance against damage dealt by spells. However, any bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage dealt to you, ignores the shield and damage your hit points directly.
Vous devez terminer un repos court ou long avant de pouvoir utiliser à nouveau cette fonction.

subclassFeature.name: Disruptive Mark
entries: À partir du 6e niveau, vous pouvez perturber la concentration des lanceurs de sorts. À votre tour, vous pouvez choisir une créature que vous pouvez voir dans un rayon de 30 pieds autour de vous et y placer une marque perturbatrice. Pendant la minute suivante, tant que la créature marquée se trouve à moins de 30 pieds de vous, vous gagnez les avantages suivants :

items: Chaque fois que la créature lance un sort, elle doit d'abord réussir un jet de sauvegarde de Constitution contre votre DC de sauvegarde de sort pour maintenir sa concentration. En cas d'échec, l'incantation est interrompue, le sort échoue et les emplacements de sorts sont gaspillés.

Chaque fois que la créature commence son tour en se concentrant sur un sort, elle doit effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Constitution contre le DC de sauvegarde du sort pour maintenir sa concentration. En cas d'échec, elle perd sa concentration sur le sort.

entries: Vous ne pouvez marquer qu'une seule créature avec votre marque perturbatrice à la fois.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Nullzone
entries: Au 14ème niveau, votre seule présence perturbe les effets magiques. Si vous êtes la cible d'un effet magique dommageable lancé par une créature que vous pouvez voir, vous pouvez utiliser votre réaction pour dépenser un nombre de points de sorcellerie égal au niveau du sort (au minimum 1) et réduire de moitié les dégâts que le sort infligerait à toute créature affectée.

subclassFeature.name: Overpower
entries: At 18th level, you can cast the {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic} spells at 3rd level against the target of your disruptive mark without expending spell slots. If the marked creature is within 30 feet of you, you have advantage on the spellcasting ability check for these spells. You can cast these spells against a marked creature even if you don't know them.

You can cast both spells at a higher levvel by spending a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level. For example, if you want to cast {@spell counterspell|phb} at 5th level, you can spend 5 sorcery points instead of a 5th level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: The Great Wurm
entries: Millennia have passed since the terrifying being, known as The Great Wurm, was banished by the Radiant Cocoon. However, the Wurm has left a festering scar on the Material Plane, from which its tendrils still stretch out to touch the souls of unlucky mortals. Outcasts, driven away from their hives. Those who have been mistreated their whole lives for being different. Folk that can't find a place to fit in. When these kinds of beings cry out their pain into the void, the void calls back with a promise to fix all their problems.

Warlocks of the Wurm become harbingers of the maw. These beings become insatiable creatures that want to see the world plunged into the eternal nothingness of chaos. For in chaos, nobody is different.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Le Wurm vous permet de choisir parmi une liste étendue de sorts lorsque vous apprenez un sort de sorcier. Les sorts suivants sont ajoutés à la liste des sorts de sorcier pour vous.

subclassFeature.name: Unnatural Resilience
entries: Au 1er niveau, vous gagnez une action bonus que vous pouvez utiliser à chacun de vos tours pour gagner des points de vie temporaires égaux à votre niveau de sorcier + votre bonus de compétence, en remplacement des points de vie temporaires que vous avez déjà.

Additionally, starting at 10th level, as part of this bonus action, you can spend hit dice to add to this temporary HP. The additional temporary hit points equal the number you roll on your hit dice, plus your proficiency bonus. You can spend a number of Hit Dice at once equal to half your Proficiency bonus rounded up.

subclassFeature.name: Gluttonous Physique
entries: Also at 1st level, your resilience makes you an unstoppable force in combat. You can use your Constitution modifier, instead of Strength, for melee weapon attack and damage rolls. You can also use your Constitution modifier, instead of Strength, when making an Athletics check to initiate or escape a grapple or shove another creature.
Furthermore, you gain resistance to acid damage and proficiency in shields and medium and heavy armor. Finally, when you use heavy armor, the strength requirement needed to wear it is reduced by 2.

subclassFeature.name: Spawn of the Wurm
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can summon a leech to attach itself to the creature. The leech is a tiny beast with AC 6, 1 hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of 1 foot. While on the target's skin, the leech can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action.
At the start of each of the creature's turns, the leech deals {@dice 1d4} points of piercing damage to it and you regain hit points equal to the amount of piercing damage dealt.
Once the leech dealt 24 points of damage falls of the creature skin and dies, dealing no further damage to it.
You can create a number of leeches equal to your Proficiency bonus. You regain all uses of this ability after you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Insatiable
entries: At 10th level, if you already have temporary hit points and receive more of them, you can add them together instead of replacing them.

You can't gain temporary hit points from the same source more than once unless your current pool of temporary hit points is depleted or you replace your current temporary hit points. Replacing your current temporary hit points also allows all other sources to be stacked again.
The number of sources you can stack this way equals half your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Consume
entries: Au 14e niveau, vous pouvez rendre votre faim insatiable tangible et absorber la force vitale des créatures qui vous entourent. Chaque créature située dans un cube de 3 mètres partant de vous doit effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Constitution, subissant {@dice 4d6} de dégâts nécrotiques en cas d'échec, ou la moitié des dégâts en cas de réussite. Vous regagnez un nombre de points de vie égal à la moitié des dégâts infligés.
Une fois que vous avez utilisé cette fonction, vous ne pouvez plus le faire jusqu'à ce que vous ayez terminé un long repos.

subclassFeature.name: Pact Boon Option
entries: {@i 3rd-level warlock feature}
If the Game Master allows it, at 3rd level, the warlock gains the following additional choice of pact boon.
{@optfeature Pact of the Maw|PGInsec}

subclassFeature.name: School of Sonomancy
entries: While bards use enchanting melodies to cast their tantalizing spells, the wizards from the school of sonomancy view sound differently. While the songs of bard flow with emotion, the sounds of sonomancy vibrate with logic. They use their arcane abilities to creating vibrating Sound Weapons, stop projectiles in mid air, or to cast their spells without the need for vocal components.

Wizards of this school are often found in battle, and many of them are battle-hardened veterans. Many foes of such wizards only hear a faint hum before they realise that a vibrating dagger plunged into their hearts.

subclassFeature.name: Channeling Sound
entries: Lorsque vous choisissez cette école au 2e niveau, vous gagnez la maîtrise d'un instrument de votre choix et vous pouvez utiliser cet instrument comme centre d'intérêt pour le lancement de sorts.
Furthermore, as you learn to shield yourself against forceful sounds preemptively, you gain resistance to thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Sound Weapons
entries: Also at 2nd level, you learn how to control weapons with the vibrations of your magic. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one weapon that you are proficient with, which has the light property. The weapon becomes your Sound Weapon. You can also transform a magic weapon into your Sound Weapon.

Using a bonus action, you can make your Sound Weapon vibrate, letting it float in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you for 1 minute. When you animate your Sound Weapon in this way, you can immediately make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the sound weapon.

When attacking with your Sound Weapon in this way, it deals thunder damage instead of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Should the weapon have any additional effects, they apply as if you would be wielding or attacking with it normally.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

You can catch your sound weapon when it is within 5 feet of you and stop the vibrations as a free action. If you fall unconscious, your Sound Weapon drops on the ground in the space it is floating in.
You can use this feature to let your Sound Weapon float twice. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Protective Vibration
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can protect yourself from attacks by letting the air around you vibrate.

When a creature hits you with a ranged weapon attack or ranged spell attack, you can use your reaction to block the attack from truly reaching you. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your wizard level.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Pitch
entries: À partir du 10e niveau, vous gagnez la capacité de distinguer parfaitement les sons et votre maîtrise des vibrations atteint de nouveaux sommets. Vous pouvez lancer tous vos sorts sans nécessiter de composantes vocales.
De plus, vous bénéficiez d'un avantage sur tous les contrôles de Sagesse ({@skill Perception}) qui dépendent de l'ouïe et vous gagnez la vue aveugle dans un rayon de 3 mètres.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Sound Weapon
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can create an additional Sound Weapon.
Using your bonus action you can make both Sound Weapons vibrate and

optionalfeature.name: Floating Weapon
entries: By using a bonus action to speak a command word, the weapon starts to float in the air in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the wielder. As a bonus action on the wielders turn, they can move the weapon up to 20 feet and make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon using your spell-attack modifier. On a hit, the weapon deals damage equal to the weapons damage die + your Intelligence modifier.
L'arme peut retourner dans la main du manieur en utilisant une action bonus tant que l'arme se trouve à moins de 1,5 m de lui.

optionalfeature.name: Periapt of Poison Immunity
entries: While wearing this pendant, a creature gains gains resistance to poison damage and inmunity to poisoned condition.

optionalfeature.name: Whip of Ensnaring
entries: Cette arme magique confère un bonus de +1 aux jets d'attaque et de dégâts effectués avec elle.

The weapon has 4 charges. When the wielder of this weapon hits a Large or smaller creature with an attack roll, they can expend 1 charge to ensnare their target. The creature has to succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC, or become restrained. The wielder can't attack with the whip as long as it is restraining a creature. The creature can use their action to repeat their saving throw to break free from the whip.
L'arme regagne {@dice 1d4} de charges quotidiennement à l'aube.

optionalfeature.name: Air Shield
entries: When you or an ally within 30 feet of you are hit by a ranged weapon attack you can use use your reaction to spend one or more Gust Points to deflect the missile. When you do so, the damage you or your ally take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d6} + your Dexterity modifier + your fighter level.
For every additional Gust Point you spend on this feature, the damage from the attack is reduced by an additional {@dice 1d4}.

optionalfeature.name: Airstream
entries: You can use a bonus action to create one or more airstreams. Each stream is 5 feet wide, and its length is equal to twice the flying speed of your Tailwind feature. The stream has to originate from your current position and lasts until the start of your next turn.

The area of the airstream is considered difficult terrain, except for you and any creature of your choice. While inside the stream, you or a chosen creature can spend 1 foot of movement to move 2 feet. If the stream crosses already-existing difficult terrain, you or a chosen creature can move through the space at your normal speed. In addition, while inside the stream, the jump height and length of you and your chosen creatures are doubled.
Each stream costs one Gust Point to create. You can create a number of streams equal to your proficiency bonus each turn.

optionalfeature.name: Hurricane Ward
entries: You can use a bonus action to spend one or more Gust Points to create a 10-foot wide and 10-foot tall pillar of strong wind (20 miles per hour) in an area within 30 feet of you. The wind has the effects of the {@spell Warding Wind|xge} spell. The wind disperses at the start of your next turn.
Pour chaque point de rafale supplémentaire que vous dépensez pour cette caractéristique, le pilier de vent fort s'élargit et s'élève de 10 pieds.

optionalfeature.name: Updraft
entries: When you hit a medium or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 2 Gust Points to create an intense burst of wind below the creature. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Typhoon's Champion save DC. On a success, the creature is unaffected. On a failed save, the creature is lifted 10 feet straight up into the air.
If the creature is airborne and fails its save, it is raised 10 feets higher and falls {@condition prone}.
Si vous dépensez un point de souffle supplémentaire, vous pouvez utiliser cette capacité sur une créature de grande taille.

optionalfeature.name: Gale Slash
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend one or more Gust Points to create a strong burst of wind in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide line that starts from the creature you hit and extends directly away from you. Each creature in that line must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Typhoon's Champion save DC or be shoved back 20 feet in a straight line.
For every additional Gust Point you use on this feature, the burst's distance grows by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Wall
entries: You can use an action to spend three or more Gust Points to Cast the {@spell Wind Wall|phb} spell. The Wall disperses at the start of your next turn.
For every additional Gust Point you spend on this feature, the wind wall lasts an additional round.

optionalfeature.name: Squall Stride
entries: You can use an action to spend one Gust Point to strengthen the winds that carry you. You can immediately move up to your speed. During this turn, while you move, you can move through the space of any hostile creature. If you do so, you can force the creature to make a Strength saving throw against your Typhoon's Champion save DC. On a failure, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from you in a straight line. On a success, the creature is unaffected, but you can still move through the creature's space. You still can't end your movement in another creature's space.
You can only push creatures of Medium or smaller size, and a creature can't be pushed by this ability more than once per turn.
If you spend an additional Gust Point, you can push creatures of Large size.

optionalfeature.name: Eye of the Cyclone
entries: You can use an action to spend four Gust points to create a 50 ft. high and 30 ft. wide cyclone centered around you. A creature that enters the cyclone must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Typhoon's Champion save DC, taking {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
The cyclone dissipates at the beginning of your next turn unless you spend 2 Gust points to keep it active. The cyclone moves with you if you move while it is active.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Echo
entries: When you take damage through a spell, you can use your reaction to spend a sorcery point to cast the same spell against the original caster. A spell cast in this way uses a spell slot like casting it normally would. Furthermore, you must provide any material components that the spell requires. The damage type of the spell changes to necrotic.

optionalfeature.name: Leeching Spell
entries: Lorsque vous effectuez un jet de dégâts pour un sort qui cible une seule créature, vous pouvez dépenser 3 points de sorcellerie pour regagner un nombre de points de vie égal à la moitié des dégâts infligés, jusqu'à un montant maximum de la moitié de votre total de points de vie.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Maw
entries: The pact with your patron transforms your esophagus into the entrance to the maw, a spherical demiplane roughly 10 feet in diameter. When swallowing an item or creature, you can use a bonus action to open the gateway to the maw. Anything you swallow while the entrance is open is transported inside the maw, and you don't take damage when swallowing in this way. The weight of objects inside the maw doesn't increase your weight. While the gateway to the maw is open, you can expand your mouth to swallow larger objects. The object can't be larger than 5 feet in all dimensions. You can close the gateway to the maw as a free action.

Additionally, you can use an action to enlarge your mouth to swallow a medium-sized or smaller creature. Make a melee spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the creature is transported to the maw. You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

A creature inside the maw can make a Strength check against your spell save DC at the start of each of its turns to break free. If it succeeds, you regurgitate the creature in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. A creature inside the maw can't interact with any objects inside it, and you can only have one creature inside the maw at a time.

If an extradimensional space created by a {@item bag of holding|dmg}, {@item Heward's handy haversack|dmg}, {@item portable hole|dmg} or similar item is placed inside your maw, it destroys the item immediately and a gate to the Astral Plane is opened in your space. Any creature (including yourself) within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

optionalfeature.name: Slavering Gorge
entries: Your tongue grows in size and lashes out to grapple a creature within 30 feet of you. You can use an action to make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature is grappled (escape DC is equal to your spell save DC) by your tongue and pulled to an unoccupied space adjacent to you.
While grappling a creature in this way, you have disadvantage on any attack roll against creatures other than the grappled creature.
When you use the swallow action from your pact boon against the grappled creature, you have advantage on the melee spell attack.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the All Consumer
entries: You can eat an endless amount without suffering ill effects, including generally inedible materials (like wood, metal, or earth), though only food will sustain you.

Additionally, during a short rest, you can consume food to regain vitality. You regain a hit die for every day's worth of food you consume. If you are at your maximum amount of hit dice, you immediately regain hit points as if you'd expended a hit die. You can benefit from a number of rations equal to half your warlock level (rounded up) for each short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Glutton's Delight
entries: You can cast heroes' feast once without expending a spell slot and without providing material components. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

hp.special: 3 + three times your ranger level (the drone has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your ranger level).

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} + 2 + your Proficiency Bonus to hit, range 5ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 1d6} + 2 + your Proficiency Bonus bludgeoning damage, and a Large or smaller target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC equals to your spell save DC). Until this grapple ends, the drone can't use its Pincer attack against another target.

action.name: Charge
entries: The drone inmediately moves 20 feet in a straight line in a direction you choose. If the drone passes through a creature's space, the creature has to succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.

hp.special: 2 + two times your ranger level (the drone has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your ranger level).

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} + 2 + your Proficiency Bonus to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@dice 1d8} + 2 + your Proficiency Bonus piercing damage.

action.name: Stinger Shot
entries: {@atk rw} + 2 + your Proficiency Bonus to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}{@dice 1d6} + 2 + your Proficiency Bonus piercing damage.

hp.special: 2 + two times your ranger level (the drone has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your ranger level).

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Le drone peut grimper sur des surfaces difficiles, y compris à l'envers sur des plafonds, sans avoir besoin de faire un test d'aptitude.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web created from the drones {@action Sticky Web|Trap Spider|PGtI} action, the drone and you, know the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

action.name: Fangs
entries: {@atk mw} + 1 + your Proficiency Bonus to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@dice 1d4} + 1 + your Proficiency Bonus, piercing damage.

action.name: Web Shot
entries: Choisissez une créature dans un rayon de 30 pieds autour du drone. La cible doit réussir un jet de sauvegarde de Dextérité contre le DC de sauvegarde de votre sort, ou être {@condition restrained} par une toile collante pendant la prochaine minute. Comme action à chacun de ses tours, une créature {@condition restrained} peut effectuer un jet de sauvegarde de Force contre votre DC de sauvegarde contre les sorts pour se libérer.

action.name: Sticky Web {@recharge 5}
entries: The drone spins a web on a horizontal or vertical surface in a 30-foot circle centered on the drone. Any creature of your choice moving across the webbed surface is unaffected by difficult terrain and can climb vertifcal surfaces using their movement speed without making an ability check. For other creatures, the web's area is considered difficult terrain.

feat.name: Adamantine Chitin
entries: Your shell has become as strong as adamant, capable of withstanding even the mightiest of attacks. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Constitution score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
You gain +1 bonus to AC.
When you suffer a critical hit, you can use your reaction to turn that attack into a normal hit. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Ancient Knowledge
entries: You are specially studious and pick up new skills with ease. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Intelligence score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
You gain one skill proficiency of your choice, one tool proficiency of your choice, and fluency in one language of your choice.

Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain expertise with that skill, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as {@feat Expertise}, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Blind Spot
entries: You evolved some psionic capabilities, seldom seen in Warrior. You gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Intelligence, Charisma or Wisdom score by 1, up to maximum of 20.

As an action, you can choose a creature within 30 feet of you to make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma modifier). On a failed save, the creature perceives you as if you were invisible for 1 minute. Should the creature have special senses which allows it to see invisible creatures, such as blindsight, you still appear invisible to it. If the creature takes damage from you, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. You have to finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

feat.name: Burning Blade
entries: Vous maîtrisez davantage la magie du feu destructrice de votre peuple. Vous gagnez les avantages suivants :

items: Increase your Strength, Dexterity or Charisma score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

You learn the {@spell flame blade} spell, and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast the spell in this way when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.
When making a melee spell attack with the {@spell flame blade} you can use Strength or Dexterity modifiers for the attack roll.

Lorsque vous effectuez un jet de dégâts de feu pour un sort que vous lancez, vous pouvez relancer tout jet de 1 sur les dés de dégâts de feu, mais vous devez utiliser le nouveau jet, même si c'est un autre 1.

feat.name: Crushing Grip
entries: La puissance de votre grappin est capable de broyer les os de vos ennemis avec facilité. Vous gagnez les avantages suivants :

items: Increase your Strength, Dexterity or Wisdom score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

While reared up, you can {@condition grapple} a creature while both of your hands are occupied, using your body to coil around the creature. When you are grappling a creature in this way and get down to your normal size, you let go of the creature and it is no longer {@condition grappled} by you.
On the start of each of their turns, a creature {@condition grappled} by you takes {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage.

feat.name: Cold Refusal
entries: Votre carapace de cristal est recouverte de glace glaciale. Vous gagnez les avantages suivants :

items: Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Vous gagnez une résistance aux dégâts de feu.
Cold, fire and nonmagical slashing damage you take is reduce by 3.

At the end of a long rest, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes cold damage equal to 5 x your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Death Chirp
entries: Increase your Constitution score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

You can use an action to emit a high pitched sound in a 15-foot radius around you.
